Associate members pay $25 and Affiliate members pay $15 a year; Individual
members pay $7.50. For this fee members receive our monthly Newsletter:
the NAEB Journal; the various reports and surveys we publish periodically;
services of our Placement Service, television engineer, legal counsel,
management consultant, etc.;plus the normal day to day services, informa¬
tion and advice that any national organization gives its members. Under
separate cover we are sending you samples of some of the materials we
regularly send our members, plus other items which will give you more
information about the association. Of course. Associate, Affiliate and
Individual members do not receive as many of these materials as regularly
as Active members do.
Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of the NAEB
Radio Network upon payment of an annual network fee. The Network distributes
approximately eight hours of programming, by tape recording, weekly, to
members subscribing to its service. This fee is also based on power (with
the same power classifications as membership) and a new station does not
have to pay the full fee until the third year it is in the Network. The
fees are s

Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and
from Network Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even a Class
A station paying its full third-year rate is paying only a little over
$2 an hour far better than 400 hours of programming from the Network in
a year. This is about the most inexpensive programming a station can do.
If, after looking over the materials which we shall send you, you have
further questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
